txt.en: Talk to Agalûnu
You have led Agalûnu to Shanthar's abode in the wooded grove of Arwáth. You should listen to their conversation.
Listen to the conversation
'Why do you return to this grove once more, tree-hewer?'
Follow Agalûnu
'How is it that you do not understand that you are unwelcome here?'
'I... I did not think of these things.'
Talk to Agalûnu
'I did not expect you to. I only ask that you leave Arwáth.'
'Speak with me, [placeholder].'
'I want to help!'
Outraged that a Kinta Elf shot her with an arrow in an attempt to get her to leave Arwáth, Agalûnu has asked you to escort her into the grove to confront Shanthar.
'Help what?'
Listen to the conversation
'Help with whatever it is you do here, and I will fell no more trees!'
'Though I would need to find some other livelihood.'
Listen to the conversation
Talk to Agalûnu
Admire the mural
Walk with Agalûnu
<rgb=#00FF00>Look</rgb> at the beauty of Arwáth
Listen to the conversation
Talk to Mêshka

'I did not expect this [placeholder]. Have I and my forebears really been party to the destruction of a forest that covered the entire Ikorbân Valley? That is just awful. I can see why this Elf would not like us overmuch!'
'Thank you for your assistance with making this all come together.'
Walk with Agalûnu
Listen to the conversation
'Oh, [placeholder], this place is so lovely! Just look at it!'
Listen to the conversation

'[placeholder], can you believe him? How galling!'

Agalûnu turns to Shanthar.

'I understand that you wish for solitude and to hoard this wood for yourself, but what I do not understand is why. Why should one Elf sit upon this grove like a dragon sitting upon piles of gold?'
You have led Agalûnu to Shanthar's abode in the wooded grove of Arwáth. You should stop and appreciate the beauty of the grove with Agalûnu.
You have led Agalûnu to Shanthar's abode in the wooded grove of Arwáth. You should follow Agalûnu.
You have led Agalûnu to Shanthar's abode in the wooded grove of Arwáth. Agalûnu wants to talk to you.

'Thank you for your assistance with making this all come together, [placeholder]. When I first asked for your help, I was unsure of your intentions, or if you would even show. I must tell you though that I am glad you did. Belondor has told me that you have been aiding him, and I am glad for him to have a friend.\n\n'It is my hope that this memorial will help him move past his current unease. He has not been kind to himself. He will not be able to do what he needs to in such a state.'
You have led Agalûnu to Shanthar's abode in the wooded grove of Arwáth. You should listen to the conversation between Agalûnu and Shanthar.
Talk to Agalûnu
Mêshka has commissioned a mural in memory of the fallen crew of the Rebuke. Everyone is present, and the memorial is ready to begin. You should take a moment to look at the mural.
You have led Agalûnu to Shanthar's abode in the wooded grove of Arwáth. Agalûnu wants to talk to you.
Follow Mêshka
'Come [placeholder], let us return to my camp. I have much to think about, and I am also not feeling so well.'
You see a painting of Belondor valiantly attempting to defend his doomed crew from Azagath
Talk to Shanthar
Listen to the conversation
You have led Agalûnu to Shanthar's abode in the wooded grove of Arwáth. You should listen to the conversation between Agalûnu and Shanthar.
The secluded grove is peaceful and majestic
You have led Agalûnu to Shanthar's abode in the wooded grove of Arwáth. You should talk to Agalûnu.
'Wood can be harvested if done responsibly.'
'I may regret this, but if you wish to learn, I will teach you.'
You have led Agalûnu to Shanthar's abode in the wooded grove of Arwáth. Agalûnu wants to talk to you.
'Master Elf, I would be honoured to be your student and learn to care for the forests.'
'Then it will be so.'
'It is a beautiful day, but we should not dally overmuch. Is that the Elf's abode just ahead?'

Shanthar gazes at the woman, his expression unreadable.

'You know not of which you speak, child. I have sworn an oath to steward these grounds and protect them with my life. Why I have done so is none of your concern. What I do not understand is why Men insist on destroying everything beautiful in Middle-earth.

'Trees provide shade, they disrupt harsh winds, they protect the soil from the river. They provide homes to birds, squirrels and insects. They provide food for all. Long ago, this entire valley was a forest, dense with trees exactly like these. Then Men came and 'put them to use' as you would do. They are already in use, only you do not see it.'
You have led Agalûnu to Shanthar's abode in the wooded grove of Arwáth. Shanthar has something to say to Agalûnu.
Instance: The Fading of the Forests
You have led Agalûnu to Shanthar's abode in the wooded grove of Arwáth. You should listen to their conversation.
